message: How to spend your time at Open Day: make sure you chat to one of our friendly student ambassadors. They can tell you what it’s like to study here! http://www.birmingham.ac.uk/undergraduate/visit/ug-opendays.aspx#hellobrum

HSMC wants to hear from you – share your view with us and be entered into a prize draw to win a £250 charity donation!  The Health Services Management Centre at Birmingham is currently reviewing its programmes and services to make sure that they meet your needs. We’d be very grateful if you could help us by filling in our quick online survey which will take just a few minutes of your time; all surveys will be entered into a prize draw to win a £250 donation for a registered charity of your choice. You can complete the online survey by visiting https://www.snapsurveys.com/wh/s.asp?k=140119021752
name: HSMC Survey

message: You can now watch the full list of TEDx University of Birmingham talks  online. There is no better way to pass the time waiting for your exam results: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C7JXrOJE3e8&list=PLsRNoUx8w3rMUOiFgpo_qV4nVy8oOOM38&index=7
Best of luck to all of our students and graduands receiving their exam results and degree results today, you're the first of many to come over the next few days!

Calling artists! The University of Birmingham is calling for expressions of interest from artists interested in undertaking a paid residency on campus. Follow the link for more details: http://www.birmingham.ac.uk/culture/artistsinres.aspx
name: Artist in Residence Scheme - University of Birmingham

message: Applications for University’s innovative Cultural Graduate Scheme are now open. The scheme is a fantastic opportunity for University of Birmingham graduates to work with some of the region’s leading cultural institutions including BBC Birmingham, Birmingham Museums Trust, CBSO and Flatpack Film Festival. Please find below a link to placement and application details: http://www.birmingham.ac.uk/culture/cultural-internship-scheme.aspx
name: Cultural Internship Scheme - University of Birmingham

message: TEDx University of Birmingham is now online, with the first three talks on evolution, conflict resolution and modern art all available on the TEDx talks YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLsRNoUx8w3rMUOiFgpo_qV4nVy8oOOM38
name: TEDx University of Birmingham 2014

message: Have you applied to study at Birmingham? Are you thinking of continuing your studies here? Are you interested in helping the University to improve its web presence? We’re after your opinions on our website, what we do well and what we could be doing better. We’d like 50 minutes (approx.) of your time to be interviewed by telephone or Skype and we’ll even pay you with a £20 Amazon voucher for your time! We’re particularly interested in your opinions if you’re thinking of applying to study here (Undergraduate, Postgraduate Taught and Postgraduate Research), or if you have already applied and are holding an offer of a place. Also, you don’t have to be located in the UK to take part, your thoughts and opinions are just as valuable to us wherever you are in the world. If you’re interested in being interviewed please contact Thomas Straw (Web Content Manager) t.straw@bham.ac.uk and we’ll be in touch with you for further information.

Our June open days on the 27th and 28th are rapidly approaching - register to come along now, and find out what the University of the Year can offer you: http://www.birmingham.ac.uk/undergraduate/visit/ug-opendays.aspx

Prospective Engineering and Physical Science students, as if you didn't have enough already, here are 10 more reasons why you should choose to study with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e5IZMIspSPk#t=18
name: 10 Reasons to Study in the College Engineering and Physical Sciences

message: Fancy working in a vibrant press office? Our Media Relations Office is looking for a Media Monitoring Assistant to capture our extensive national and international news coverage. This is the perfect opportunity for anyone who wants a career in PR.  More details and to apply: www.worklink.bham.ac.uk/WorkLink/Vacancies/VacancyDetails.asp?VacancyID=1568
name: Vacancies - WorkLink

message: A collection of photos taken by student Matthew Richards of the University's first ever TEDx event, entitled Throwing Caution to the Wind.
name: TEDx University of Birmingham

message: A big thank you to Chris Addison for delivering our annual Baggs Memorial Lecture on the theme of happiness. A lot of happy people are leaving campus this evening! The Baggs Memorial Lecture began in 1976. Thomas Baggs was an alumnus who left a sum to the University to provide for an annual public lecture on the theme of ‘Happiness - what it is and how it may be achieved by individuals as well as nations.’
The stage and rigging getting set up for Grad Ball 2014 - not long now final years! Also if you had yet to realise, we are on Instagram! Username: unibirmingham

Did you ever wonder why studying can make you so hungry? Where was the magic food buffet when you needed it? How much happier were you after ate your weight in food?If you are intrigued, take part in TWO psychology experiments happening on campus in the next few weeks - all you have to do is a bit of educational reading, answer some questions, have a free buffet, and get paid £15 for 45 minutes of your time.Email Jinyu for more details: JXL387@bham.ac.uk
Download our Open Day App and schedule your day in advance so you don't miss out on anything! http://www.birmingham.ac.uk/contact/app-store.aspx
name: University of Birmingham app store - University of Birmingham

message: Excited for UoB alumni, Mock the Week's Chris Addison to come to the University of Birmingham tonight to deliver his 'happiness lecture'!

Planning your day for our Open Days 27/28 June? Make sure you take a 45 minute tour around our beautiful campus, to get a feel for what it's like to be a student at the University of Birmingham!http://www.birmingham.ac.uk/undergraduate/visit/ug-opendays.aspx

As part of Universities Week 2014 we are hosting an R.S Peters Memorial lecture given by Professor Alan Curren, who will discuss our growing conception of education as a 'market value' as opposed to an inherent and formative value. Tomorrow at 16:30! http://www.universitiesweek.org.uk/Events/Pages/displayevent.aspx?eventid=683&postcode=B15#.U5gVhPldV0o
name: Universities Week 2014: Ideas for life - Display Event

message: If you have had any problems with the Careers Network (University of Birmingham) Virtual Fair, it might be because you have not yet enrolled - please use the following link to do so: https://canvas.bham.ac.uk/enroll/86TN9P
